intro: Pectis elongata var. divaricata, commonly known as the narrowleaf pectis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are linear and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is adapted to arid conditions and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
